intro: Stillingia appendiculata, commonly known as the goldenroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, which have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Stillingia appendiculata thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
